section.title: HttpsSender
section.para: HttpsSender is similar to the HttpSender (see ), thus it inherits the same properties. The difference is that the HttpsSender uses HTTPS instead of plain HTTP protocol to send messages.

The HttpsSender's properties are described in the following table: HttpsSender additional properties
Property name Description Required Default value
keyStore Path to the key store No -
keyStorePassword Key store password No -
trustStore Path to the trust store No -
trustStorePassword Trust store password No -

example.title: An example of HttpsSender configuration
example.programlisting: <sender class="HttpsSender"> <target>https://domain.com/secured_url</target> <property name="method" value="POST"/> <property name="trustStore" value="${my.keystores}/cacert.jks"/> <property name="trustStorePassword" value="ts_passsword"/> </sender>
